profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-04-06 16:42:15 -0400.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Use of original papers requires an appointment and is limited to the Archives' Washington, D.C., Research Center. Microfilmed materials must be consulted on microfilm. Contact Reference Services for more information.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Correspondence; biographical data; photographs; artists files; writings; financial material; a travel diary; and miscellany.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: REEL 600: Correspondence, December 1933-August 1935, comprising 88 letters between Milliken, head of the Cleveland section of the PWAP, and applying artists, the Treasury Department, and other officials of the program. In addition there are progress reports on artists' work done in the Cleveland section of PWAP, December 1933-May 1934, extensive lists of artists' projects giving city, building, and description of work, and miscellaneous papers.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: REEL 684: Typescript of an unpublished book "Stories Behind the Museum Collection," a 254 page history of the Cleveland Museum of Art, Cleveland, Ohio, written by Milliken. The history begins with the museum's inception in 1913. The date of the writing is ca. 1970.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: REEL 1096: Copy of William Milliken's autobiography, 530 p.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: REELS 1273-1279: Correspondence; biographical data; photographs; poems; lectures; addresses; radio talks; receipts and invoices for art objects given to the Cleveland Museum of Art; a travel diary, 1954-1955; and miscellany. There are files on Bernhard Berenson, Clarence Carter, Marshall Fredericks, Henry Keller, Wolfgang Dronig, Kurt Martin, Harold Parsons, Paul Travis, and others.

altformavail.head: Existence and Location of Copies
altformavail.p: 35mm microfilm reels 600, 684, 1096 & 1273-1279 available for use at Archives of American Art offices and through interlibrary loan.

originalsloc.head: Existence and Location of Originals
originalsloc.p: Reel 684: Originals returned to William M. Milliken after microfilming.

originalsloc.head: Existence and Location of Originals
originalsloc.p: Reel 600: Originals in the Cleveland Museum of Art.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Museum director; Cleveland, Ohio; d. 1978. Milliken was the curator of the Cleveland Museum of Art, 1919-1958, and director of the museum from 1930-1958.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Photostats on reel 600 donated by Cleveland Museum of Art; material on reel 684 lent for microfilming 1973 by William M. Milliken; material on reels 1096 and 1273-1279 donated 1974-1977 by William M. Milliken.

controlaccess.subject: Federal aid to the arts -- Ohio -- Cleveland
